sentences.sContent: I think we can safely assume (=  it is almost certain  ) that interest rates will go up again soon.
sentences.sCn: 我想我们几乎可以肯定，利率很快会再次上调。

sentences.sContent: When it got to midnight and Paul was still not back, I began to assume the worst (=  think that the worst possible thing had happened  ) .
sentences.sCn: 到午夜时保罗还没回来，我就开始往最坏的地方想了。

sentences.sContent: Whoever they appoint will assume responsibility for all financial matters.
sentences.sCn: 不管他们任命的是谁，他都要负责财务方面的所有事务。

sentences.sContent: These relationships assume great importance in times of crisis.
sentences.sCn: 在危急时刻，这些关系显得尤为重要。

sentences.sContent: ...The article says many people tend to assume that innovation just means creating something new...
...I assume that I can learn more from getting in touch with society...
...people consciously and rationally choose what and how much they eat and therefore focus on providing information and more access to heal thier foods...
...many regulations that don't assume people make rational choices have been successfully applied to control alcohol...
...the opponents assume that they would not stake their money on such a risky investment which does not guarantee a promising career...
...The biggest problem is that couples assume each other know what's going on with their finances...

remMethod.val: as ＋ sume(拿， 取) → 承担

trans.tranOther: to think that something is true, although you do not have definite proof
